author: Adina Steiman
title: Unclutter Your Cooking
text:
CHANCES ARE you’ve never cooked a pot of fresh haricot beans over a wood fire on the rugged Greek island of Naxos, letting them simmer until you emerged from your midday swim to find the tender legumes “just immersed in a fragrant sauce.” Yet for the expat British writer Patience Gray, this romantic vision was just a typical daily lunch. While living a nomadic life in remote Mediterranean villages with precious few resources, Ms. Gray soon learned that “good cooking is the result of a balance struck between frugality and liberality.”
